reviews.review_msg: Ross is a super engaging lecturer and all around great guy. Landscape arch ended up being one of my favourite courses in my degree even though I'm not very interested in environmental arch. He has a lot of interesting ideas, you'll get a lot out of his courses if you engage with the readings and lectures and speak up in class.

Textbook is needed to do well. My online version didn't allow me to search phrases, only keywords, so I would literally just copy paste every single paragraph into a word document and ctrl + F for exams. Thats the best advice I got, don't bother putting things into your own words it'll just make your life more difficult.

The course consisted of a whole bunch of simple, yet, super time consuming assignments. Get ready to read like no tomorrow for the exams! You can't pass the exams if you don't study the textbook! Need to memorize a lot of material for the exams. No final exam though, just 3 or 4 midterms. Honestly, if you put the time in, it's easy to do well
Such a great prof!
The course is overwhelmed with tooo much work for a 100 level course, and you can never get an A no matter how hard to try.

The course he teaches is a GPA booster and all, but he never tries to address any of the student's concerns. If you have a question, he forwards all your emails to the TA. Even if that concern is about the TA. Would high recommend taking with him, but don't expect him to respond to you.
More work than it's worth. Communication with TA for written assignments is key. Using online resources for quizzes also key.
Average prof at best. No matter how hard you work if you're not an Archaeology major you can never get even the least of As.

One of the best prof's I've taken in 6 years of college/university. Very understanding of students having other classes and will adjust his due dates if the class asks. Has weekly readings that has small in class activities worth a decent amount of your mark but they're pretty easy! Super funny, engaging and passionate about his work.
Great class, great lecturer. Make sure you do all the readings though, and come prepared for class discussions.
Not a hard class, but if you are not an archaeology major you get B+ the maximum. He favors the archaeology major students, the wierdiest thing I have ever seen.

Pretty standard easy course; potential GPA booster if you attend each class and apply effort. Following along with the posted slides during scheduled lecture time allows you to correctly answer most of the real-time TopHat questions while skipping class. If you skip, use the lecture recordings when studying for the "exams" to know what's important.

I have taken three classes with Ross. He is very funny and laid back, which is mostly a good thing. He makes lectures fun and he marks very fairly. However, he never answers emails. If you have a question, make sure to ask him during class or office hours because he won't respond to emails. Also, he takes a super long time to mark stuff.
I took this class because I heard it was a GPA booster. Instead, it killed my GPA. His 5 quizzes throughout the semester were killer with detail. I shouldn't have taken it.

I'm taking this class right now for my B-Soc requirement. The quizzes can include the most obscure details, so you're better off memorizing the lecture slides, since there is way too much in the textbook to memorize it all (I tried that, and did better when I focused on the lecture slides). First writing assignment was easy. Second yet to come.

A lot of memorization involved, but an easy 20% from TopHat (not iClicker) and written assignments worth 30%. 5 quizzes worth 10% each, noncumulative and no final exam. If you pay attention and read the book you will do well!

A really interesting professor. Probably one of the most interesting guys you'll meet at sfu. He's a enjoy to listen to, and great jokes to go along with the archaeology which sometimes can get dull... but his jokes lighten things up.

I also took this course because others say it was a GPA booster. but I ended up with B+. It indeed requires a lot of reading. Although i mostly read the textbook just one or two days before the exams. He makes the lecture interesting. Overall good course. (but it's not an easy A course.)
He is very nice and funny. I enjoyed his lecture a lot although the course requires lots of work.
I'm doing this review from this class right now. This class is a big joke, it's not going to GPA boost anything, more like it's going to KILL your GPA.

Took as a GPA booster but didn't really turn out that way. Ended up with a B+. You actually have to take this class seriously to do well because the writing assignments are total BS and seems like its marked by 5 year olds instead of PhD students. Quizzes are stupidly detailed so study the book and lectures. The free 20% for monocle cat is nice.
2 words. big disappointment. 3+ weeks to mark assignments that are worth ~7% that are 500 words? dont give me that bull. quizzes way to hard and i actually study and go to lectures
This course requires a lot of work for an elective. Expect to work hard. He is funny so it makes lecture better. The averages are pretty low for a class that is not scaled ..

Don't take this course for an easy A. Reading material is excruciatingly dry. There is A LOT of reading to do and the quizzes are very specific to TINY minor details. He is a nice guy, sometimes funny in lecture. He has recordings and lecture slides posted up but the quizzes hardly cover that.

Funny guy, quizzes are EXTREMELY HARD. I don't know how other people rated this guy so high. The only good thing about this course is the entertainment value, otherwise it's absolutely a waste of time

The only thing I can say is that there is definitely a lot of memorization involved. If you only have three or four classes I suggest you take this class and laugh your way to an A. Nothing is off limits on tests, but if you just read the textbook the night before without really retaining anything you can still get 70% on his quizzes.

Lies, all lies.... I took this course because of all the good thing's I've heard about him. I'm a biology major so I'm good a memorizing, but his course is WAY too hard for a 1st year course. Hellava too much material to know, really a hit and miss from the ~200 pages worth of dry reading material into a 50min quiz. STEER CLEAR from this course.
He is a very good professor!!
Best Prof Ever. The only prof who's voice doesn't make me want crawl back in bed. Super engaging! Best class ever.

Great prof, funny and engaging. He doesn't teach everything that is in the text, you have to keep up with reading chapters in the textbook. Lots of memorization for one quiz worth 15%, but not cumulative. After the last quiz, he had the "forest of iclicker questions" to boost your grade...hahaha.
He is a great prof that keeps you interested in the material. The quizzes/tests were fairly easy. Read the text book and pay attention in lecture.

Great Prof funny and easy going has powerpoints on webct, lecture recordings, updates your marks and progress. i-clicker questions after 5-8 slides - easy if you pay attention. Movies are interesting and helpful too. Loved his class. TAs answer emails daily too.
Jamieson is a great prof, always keeps you interested in what hes teaching and his quizzes and tests are very straightforward
A very good prof. keeps even the driest of the lectures funny by telling us stories about his experiences. Read the text and listen to his lectures you will be fine for the course.

I love this class.  Its fairly interesting and Ross Jamieson is a really fun person.  He's always joking and actually makes it fun to attend class.  Go to the lectures and do the readings and you should get an A.  His TA Lia is hot too ;).  I definetly recommend taking a course with Ross.  He's great.

instead of testing you on what ur led to be is coursecontent,he asks random trivial questions on tests.basically just random trivial facts out of 500 pages worth of readings like what pile of bones was found at what site and found by what archaeologist and what color shirt was he wearing. Total hit and miss of what garbage he will put on the test

He is one of the fun and easy going teachers. He makes the class very interesting. make sure you read the vocab in the textbook and take notes during the movies. His tests are based on exactly what he talks about in class. Tutorails are very helpful too.

Awesome Prof. He's nice, hilarious, knows his stuff, loves what he teaches, is fair, and just a really, really nice person. I loved his class - made me interested in furthering my studies in archaeology and anthropology. Definitely recommend doing at least one course with him, you'll love it even if you have no prior interest!
A great prof. Read the book and you will be fine. Check over your marks as they are often innacurate as given.

Ross is my fav prof yet! Really nice, lectures are light and fun(ny). If you are considering Arch, take a class with Ross! I didnt think Id go for Arch, but he made it pretty cool. If you do your readings and follow lec notes you'll do fine B-A. His TAs arn't great, but this class doesnt use TUTs...they cant mark accurately though. Take his class!
He is very clear, organized, and fair. However, some of the questions on exams come from very minor details, and it is not an easy course for a first year course. Nobody in the class got an A+.
Nice guy with a slightly dry sense of humour, but you can tell he loves doing what he does. Tests and quizzes are straight forward. I enjoyed this class thoroughly.

Ross is extremely clear on his expectations. Obviously his exams are not super easy, but they are straight from your lectures and textbooks. He is VERY reasonable prof, and provides many TAs who are there to help you when you need it. If you study, you will do fine in this course.
Awesome prof. Very funny, very interesting. In a three hour class, did not make us stay the whole time. Quizzes, midterm and final are pretty easy if you do the readings. Good class, got an easy A.
awesome prof. really funny and he makes the dry material interesting. Loved most of the movies we watched and the exams were pretty fair. He was a really nice guy and i recommend him.
he's funny.make sure you read the textbook!ppt notes are pretty much straight off the textbook(except for the interesting pictures).2MTs are ok.matching part is kinda hard though
I just LOVE him. If you study hard, you will get good mark. Make sure you read the textbook very carefully and memorize the important words.
going to the lectures aren't enough, textbook readings are a must for his quizzes and exams. the first quiz was easier compared to the midterm and second.

2 Quizzes, a Midterm & Final, Gives Powerpoint online but worth going to class so you understand what the powerpoints about.  Extremly Funny, as far as tests go, they are difficult and involve alot of dates/tools/locations but hey thats arch!
Great prof! funny, and a fair marker. A lot of reading in the book, but as long as you do the readings tests are fine.
This prof is one of my favorites.  He is funny and makes the 3 hr lectures very interesting. To do well in this course, you just memorize and memorize the important things.
great prof

He was a fair prof and quite funny.  Try to keep up with the readings every week.  Quizzes and the midterm were relatively easy...straight out from the readings and notes.  Exam was a little harder, just make sure to  study/memorize!  Great prof and TAs!

This course is a KILLER. There is so much reading that you will eventually lose it. Textbook reading + power point slides...all MANDATORY and the quizzes are hard. This course isnt what it used to be back in the day so please dont be fooled and ruin your GPA.

The textbook is crazy, this is a reading intensive class. But he gives fair quizes/midterms, just make sure you do the readings. He is a clear lecturer but he is quite boring sometimes. His lectures don't seem too coordinated with the readings.
Quite a bit of a humourous guy, though he did have a pretty good TA to support him in that category. In his bigger classes, everything is multiple choice too!

FUN CLASS! makes the course very interesting. VERY FUNNY MAN. definitely recommend taking this course, although a little heavy on memorization, relatively easy tests, you'll never be sleepy in class (except for that one time that he let the T.A. teach, just goes to show that ARCH would otherwise be extremely boring without him)
I love him!  Definately my favorate prof. at SFU.

Awesome prof! Was always upbeat and made jokes that stuck in your head. There were three quizzes, one midterm, and a paper, and that was it. TA was extremely helpful (he practically told us what was on the quizzes and midterms). =)
boring and bored :(
hej, not bad :)

This man is awesome!!!!!  He totally made a class I wan't too excited about totally interesting and fun!  He is always upbeat and funny, and makes you want to listen!  This is a great prof, such a nice change from the bulk of SFU's Arch dept.  Rock On Ross Jamieson!
He is a very nice guy. Easy exams.

very easy going teacher plus easy markers with TA.
 
 Tests and quiz are straight foward, if you do all readings and go to lectures. Shouldn't be hard to get a decent mark.
Great Lecturer, makes the class FUN!  He's not the easiest prof, but not the hardest either.  You've gotta go to class and listen, and don't forget to read you textbook.
He made the class so much fun and interesting!!
Very nice guy and easygoing. Very organized. However, if multiple choice exams aren't your thing, stay away from this course. The prof is funny...but the material is UNBELIEVABLY BORING.
Great sense of humour. Makes course interesting, and encourages lots of questions.
Very generous marker. Good sense of humour. Makes an otherwise boring course of names and dates enjoyable.
fun guy, like being taight by Jim Henson
He rocks
Great lecturer, enthusiastic, uses powerpoint!
Totally nice guy, very helpful
Super nice, fun, easy to understand, clear, helpful. Great overall!
